description.narrative:
let op dit project moet mee in de migratie, openstaande bedrag mag in 2019 vrijvallen GKN 20190305
Youth friendly health services in Malawi: Reducing new STI and HIV infections and teenage pregnancies amongst young people in 2 districts in Southern Malawi. • Effective linkages and referral systems established between schools and health facilities in 12 selected communities in Mangochi and Chikwawa. - Objective: a) increase in uptake of YFHS, specifically STI/HIV testing and contraceptive use; and b) improved girls empowerment to take own decisions regarding SRH.
-1800 young people between 10-15 years old (standard 7-8) in 12 primary schools in 2 districts are able to make healthy and informed choices regarding their sexual and reproductive health. - 3600 young people between 10 and 24 years old make use of the youth friendly health services in Chikwawa and Mangochi district. - Health care services and 40 staff of health centres are youth-friendly and provide care that suit the needs of young people in a non-judgmental way. - 24 Teachers in schools and 36 peer educators in youth clubs are equipped to deliver comprehensive sexuality education.
